dialogues.KAT:
[1]Leave it 
[2]I said, leave it! 
[3]Why didn't we just read the Hardy Boys? 
[4]This book is about a guy and his fishing habit.  Not exactly a crucial topic. 
[5]Frankly, I'm baffled as to why we still revere Hemingway.  He was an abusive, alcoholic misogynist who had a lot of cats. 
[6]I guess the school board thinks because Hemingway's male and an asshole, he's worthy of our time 
[7]What about Colette?  Charlotte Bronte? Simone de Beauvoir? 
[8]Expressing my opinion is not a terrorist action. 
[9]I still maintain that he kicked himself in the balls.  I was merely a spectator. 
[10]Tempestuous? 
[11]As always, thank you for your excellent guidance. 
[12]The fact that you're cutting gym so you can T.A. Sophomore English just to hear his name, is a little without in itself if you ask me. 
[13]Patrick Verona   Random skid. 
[14]I'm sure he's completely incapable of doing anything that interesting. 
[15]Block E? 
[16]Mandella, eat.  Starving yourself is a very slow way to die. 
[17]What's this? 
[18]I realize that the men of this fine institution are severely lacking, but killing yourself so you can be with William Shakespeare is beyond the scope of normal teenage obsessions.  You're venturing far past daytime talk show fodder and entering the world of those who need very expensive therapy. 
[19]Okay, say you do it.  You kill yourself, you end up in wherever you end up and he's there.  Do you really think he's gonna wanna dace a ninety pound compulsive who failed volleyball? 
[20]Yeah, and I noticed the only part of you featured in your big Kmart spread was your elbow.  Tough break. 
[21]The people at this school are so incredibly foul. 
[22]Remove head from sphincter!  Then pedal! 
[23]"Undulating with desire, Adrienne removes her crimson cape, revealing her creamy --" 
[24]Sadly, no.  But it's only four-thirty. 
[25]Where've you been? 
[26]How touching. 
[27]I guess I got in 
[28]I know. 
[29]You decided. 
[30]Ask Bianca who drove her home 
[31]This from someone whose diary is devoted to favorite grooming tips? 
[32]So he has this huge raging fit about Sarah Lawrence and insists that I go to his male-dominated, puking frat boy, number one golf team school. I have no say at all. 
[33]William didn't even go to high school 
[34]Neither has his heterosexuality. 
[35]I appreciate your efforts toward a speedy death, but I'm consuming. Do you mind? 
[36]If I was Bianca, it would be, "Any school you want, precious.  Don't forget your tiara." 
[37]Janice Parker is an idiot 
[38]Sweating like a pig, actually.  And yourself? 
[39]My mission in life. 
[40]Obviously, I've struck your fancy. So, you see, it worked.  The world makes sense again. 
[41]Oh, right.  Friday. 
[42]Like where?  The 7-Eleven on Burnside? Do you even know my name, screwboy? 
[43]Doubtful.  Very doubtful. 
[44]I have the potential to smack the crap out of you if you don't get out of my way. 
[45]I don't really think you warrant that strong an emotion. 
[46]And why would I do that? 
[47]You -- covered in my vomit. 
[48]Are you following me? 
[49]Hi 
[50]Depends on the topic. My fenders don't really whip me into a verbal frenzy. 
[51]Hey -- do you mind? 
[52]Then tell them I had a seizure. 
[53]I thought you were punishing me. 
[54]Because you're making decisions for me. 
[55]So what I want doesn't matter? 
[56]I want to go to an East Coast school! I want you to trust me to make my own choices.  I want -- 
[57]It means that Gigglepuss is playing at Club Skunk and we're going. 
[58]What do you think? 
[59]Let's hit it. 
[60]No fear. 
[61]Hello!  We'd like two for Gigglepuss! 
[62]I need agua! 
[63]Shit 
[64]Two waters. 
[65]You're not fooling anyone. 
[66]If you're planning on asking me out you might as well get it over with.  
[67]That's what you want, isn't it? 
[68]You're not surrounded by your usual cloud of smoke. 
[69]Oh, really? 
[70]You know who The Raincoats are? 
[71]What? 
[72]Who cares? 
[73]Gigglepuss was so beyond. 
[74]So true. 
[75]What's normal? 
[76]At least I'm not a clouted fen- sucked hedge-pig. 
[77]It's Shakespeare.  Maybe you've heard of him? 
[78]I know about the goddamn party.  I'm going. 
[79]Can we go now? 
[80]I'm driving. 
[81]Wait -- was that?-- Did your hairline just recede? 
[82]Away. 
[83]Leave my sister alone. 
[84]
[85]"I'm getting trashed, man." Isn't that what you're supposed to do at a party? 
[86]Funny, you're the only one 
[87]Bianca, I need to talk to you -- I need to tell you -- 
[88]I want another one 
[89]I'm fine. I'm 
[90]I just need to lie down for awhile 
[91]I know, just let me sleep 
[92]Okay, I'll just sleep but stay awake, okay? 
[93]This is so patronizing. 
[94]Why 're you doing this? 
[95]You don't care if I die 
[96]Why? 
[97]Like you could find one 
[98]Just let me sit down. 
[99]Who? 
[100]I hate him. 
[101]Hey man. . .  You don ' t think I can be "cool"?  You don't think I can be "laid back" like everyone else? 
[102]You know what they say 
[103]What? 
[104]Go away 
[105]You're welcome. 
[106]It's my car. 
[107]But it's Gigglepuss - I know you like them.  I saw you there. 
[108]When you were gone last year -- where were you? 
[109]Were you in jail? 
[110]No, you weren't 
[111]Why'd you lie? 
[112]I should do this. 
[113]This. 
[114]My father wouldn't approve of that that 
[115]Oh, so now you think you know me? 
[116]The only thing people know about me is that I'm "scary". 
[117]He just wants me to be someone I'm not. 
[118]
[119]You know -- you're not as vile as I thought you were. 
[120]I didn't have a choice. 
[121]I did Bianca a favor and it backfired. 
[122]I got drunk.  I puked.  I got rejected. It was big fun. 
[123]Can you even imagine?  Who the hell would go to this a bastion of commercial excess? 
[124]Listen to you!  You sound like Betty, all pissed off because Archie is taking Veronica. 
[125]You ' re looking at this from the wrong perspective.  We're making a statement. 
[126]What are you doing here? 
[127]You 're so -- 
[128]Unwelcome. 
[129]Don't for one minute think that you had any effect whatsoever on my panties. 
[130]Other than my upchuck reflex? Nothing. 
[131]Excuse me, Mr. Chapin? 
[132]Sir, I'd like to state for the record that Mr. Verona ' s current incarceration is unnecessary.  I never filed a complaint. 
[133]But, Mr. Chapin, I hardly think a simple serenade warrants a week of detention.  There are far more hideous acts than off-key singing being performed by the student body on a regular basis. 
[134]Wait, Mr. Chapin.  There's something I've always wanted to show you. 
[135]These. 
[136]Thank you, Mr. Chapin. 
[137]He left!  I sprung the dickhead and he cruised on me. 
[138]C'mon.  It's not that bad 
[139]Put your right foot there -- 
[140]You want me to climb up and show you how to get down? 
[141]You shit! 
[142]The Partridge Family? 
[143]Good call. 
[144]I dazzled him with my wit 
[145]Yeah, well, don't let it get out 
[146]Acting the way we do. 
[147]I don't like to do what people expect. Then they expect it all the time and they get disappointed when you change. 
[148]Something like that 
[149]How? 
[150]For. . . ? 
[151]Damn it! 
[152]State trooper? 
[153]The duck? 
[154]I know the porn career's a lie. 
[155]Tell me something true. 
[156]No -- something real.  Something no one else knows. 
[157]What? 
[158]You're amazingly self-assured. Has anyone ever told you that? 
[159]Is that a request or a command? 
[160]No. 
[161]No, I won't go with you 
[162]Because I don't want to. It's a stupid tradition. 
[163]Why are you doing this? 
[164]All of it -- what's in it for you? 
[165]Create a little drama?  Start a new rumor?  What? 
[166]You tell me. 
[167]Answer the question, Patrick 
[168]Listen, I know you hate having to sit home because I'm not Susie High School. 
[169]I do care. But I'm a firm believer in doing something for your own reasons, not someone else ' s . 
[170]Joey never told you we went out, did he? 
[171]In 9th.  For a month 
[172]He was, like, a total babe 
[173]Now I do.  Back then, was a different story. 
[174]He said everyone was doing it.  So I did it. 
[175]Just once.  Afterwards, I told him I didn't want to anymore.  I wasn't ready. He got pissed.  Then he broke up with me. 
[176]After that, I swore I'd never do anything just because "everyone else" was doing it.  And I haven't since. Except for Bogey's party, and my stunning gastro-intestinal display -- 
[177]I wanted to let you make up your own mind about him. 
[178]That's not 
[179]I guess I thought I was protecting you. 
[180]Not all experiences are good, Bianca. You can't always trust the people you want to. 
[181]Feel like shopping? 
[182]Hey, guys. I'm going to the prom. See you in a few. 
[183]How'd you get a tux at the last minute? 
[184]It's just something I had.  You know 
[185]Look, I'm  -- sorry -- that I questioned your motives.  I was wrong. 
[186]are you ready? 
[187]C'mon.  Let's get this over with. 
[188]Quite the ostentatious display 
[189]Who? 
[190]Oh, honey -- tell me we haven't' progressed to full-on hallucinations. 
[191]What? 
[192]That ' s completely adorable! 
[193]You were paid to take me out!  By -- the one person I truly hate.  I knew it was a set-up! 
[194]Really?  What was it like?  A down payment now, then a bonus for sleeping with me? 
[195]You are so not what I thought you were. 
[196]I ' m sure . 
[197]So did you 
[198]Yeah.  She left with some bikers Big ones.  Full of sperm. 
[199]No, Daddy. 
[200]Parts of it. 
[201]The part where Bianca beat the hell out of some guy. 
[202]What's the matter?  Upset that I rubbed off on her? 
[203]When I go? 
[204]For what? 
[205]Family emergency. 
[206]You set me up. 
[207]What? To completely damage me?  To send me to therapy forever? What? 
[208]Am I supposed to feel better? Like, right now?  Or do I have some time to think about it? 
[209]It's just you. 
[210]I'11 go 
[211]I hate the way you talk to me/ and the way you cut your hair/ I hate the way you drive my car/ I hate it when you stare. 
[212]I hate your big dumb combat boots/ and the way you read my mind/ I hate you so much it makes me sick/ it even makes me rhyme. 
[213]I hate the way you're always right/ I hate it when you lie/ I hate it when you make me laugh/ even worse when you make me cry/ I hate it that you're not around/ and the fact that you didn't call/ But mostly I hate the way I don ' t hate you/ not even close, not even a little bit, not even any at all. 
[214]A Fender Strat. You bought this? 
[215]Is that right? 
[216]You can't just buy me a guitar every time you screw up, you know. 
[217]And don't just think you can 
[218]Why is my veggie burger the only burnt object on this grill? 
[219]Oh, Bianca?  Can you get me my freshman yearbook? 
[220]You're freaked over this, aren't you? 
[221]I'd like to call your attention to Patrick Verona's stunning bad-ass look of 1995 --- 
[222]Perm?
dialogues.PATRICK:
[1]I missed you. 
[2]It was a bratwurst.  I was eating lunch. 
[3]Mother Goose? 
[4]Touch of the flu. 
[5]How 'bout your sex life? 
[6]What's to discuss? 
[7]Well, you know -- there's the prestige of the job title... and the benefits package is pretty good... 
[8]What? 
[9]Yeah 
[10]Two legs, nice rack... 
[11]Sure, Sparky.  I'll get right on it. 
[12]You need money to take a girl out 
[13]Yeah, I'd take her to Europe if I had the plane. 
[14]You're gonna pay me to take out some girl? 
[15]How much? 
[16]I can't take a girl like that out on twenty bucks. 
[17]Fifty, and you've got your man. 
[18]Hey. Girlie. 
[19]I mean Wo-man.  How ya doin'? 
[20]There's a way to get a guy's attention. 
[21]Pick you up Friday, then 
[22]The night I take you to places you've never been before.  And back. 
[23]I know a lot more than that 
[24]You're no bargain either, sweetheart. 
[25]Hey 
[26]You hate me don't you? 
[27]Then say you'll spend Dollar Night at the track with me. 
[28]Come on -- the ponies, the flat beer, you with money in your eyes, me with my hand on your ass... 
[29]Seven-thirty? 
[30]Nice ride. Vintage fenders. 
[31]I was in the laundromat. I saw your car. Thought I'd say hi. 
[32]You're not a big talker, are you? 
[33]I'm on it 
[34]I got her under control. She just acts crazed in public to keep up the image. 
[35]I just upped my price 
[36]A hundred bucks a date. 
[37]Forget her sister, then. 
[38]Say it 
[39]Whatever the hell it is you're standin' there waitin' to say. 
[40]What plan? 
[41]What is it with this chick?  She have three tits? 
[42]Dorsey can plow whoever he wants. I'm just in this for the cash. 
[43]So Dorsey can get the girl? 
[44]You two are gonna help me tame the wild beast? 
[45]Yeah -- we'll see. 
[46]Lou, it's okay.  They're with me. 
[47]What've you got for me? 
[48]What?! 
[49]Are you telling me I'm a - "non-smoker"? 
[50]What?  You don't think I'm pretty? 
[51]So what does that give me?  I'm supposed to buy her some noodles and a book and sit around listening to chicks who can't play their instruments? 
[52]Yeah. 
[53]Don't make me do it, man 
[54]Michael -- did you get this information "illegally"? 
[55]I'm likin' you guys better 
[56]This is really music? 
[57]Always a pleasure, Brucie. 
[58]Fan of a fan.  You see a couple of minors come in? 
[59]Padua girls.  One tall, decent body. The other one kinda short and undersexed? 
[60]hey.  Great show, huh? 
[61]Excuse me? 
[62]Do you mind?  You're sort of ruining it for me. 
[63]I know.  I quit. 
[64]You know, these guys are no Bikini Kill or The Raincoats, but they're right up there. 
[65]Why, don't you? 
[66]I watched you out there   I've never seen you look like that 
[67]Come to that party with me. 
[68]I got it, Rick. 
[69]Nine-thirty then. 
[70]See you next week! 
[71]Nine-thirty right? 
[72]I'm early. 
[73]Who knocked up your sister? 
[74]What's this? 
[75]I say, do what you wanna do. 
[76]Maybe you should let me have it.  Kat is fierce in her refusal to let go  
[77]It's about time. 
[78]Do what? 
[79]Okay? 
[80]You're not okay. 
[81]Uh, uh. You lie down and you'll go to sleep 
[82]What if you have a concussion? My dog went to sleep with a concussion and woke up a vegetable. Not that I could tell the difference... 
[83]C'mon, let's walk 
[84]Cameron, I'm a little busy 
[85]What 're you talking about? 
[86]Cameron -- do you like the girl? 
[87]Then, go get her 
[88]Leave it to you to use big words when you're shitfaced. 
[89]I told you 
[90]Sure, I do 
[91]Because then I'd have to start taking out girls who like me. 
[92]See that?  Who needs affection when I've got blind hatred? 
[93]How's that? 
[94]Jesus.  You're like a weeble 
[95]Why'd you let him get to you? 
[96]Dorsey. 
[97]I know.  It'd have to be a pretty big deal to get you to mainline tequila. You don't seem like the type. 
[98]I thought you were above all that 
[99]No. What do they say? 
[100]Shit! 
[101]Jingle Bells! Jingle Belles! Wake up damn it! 
[102]Kat! Wake up! 
[103]I thought you were... 
[104]Cute 
[105]I'm driving, so I get to pick the tunes. 
[106]And I'm in control of it. 
[107]Busy 
[108]Maybe. 
[109]Then why'd you ask? 
[110]Do what? 
[111]Start a band? 
[112]You don't strike me as the type that would ask permission. 
[113]I'm gettin' there 
[114]Yeah -- well, I'm no picnic myself.  They eye each other, sharing a moment of connection, realizing they're both created the same exterior for themselves.  Patrick pulls into her driveway and shuts off the motor.  He looks up at her house.  
[115]So what ' s up with your dad?  He a pain in the ass? 
[116]Who? 
[117]No offense, but you're sister is without.  I know everyone likes her and all, but ... 
[118]So, I'll see you in school 
[119]Hey 
[120]No - I've got a sweet-payin' job that I'm about to lose. 
[121]I don ' t know. I decided not to nail her when she was too drunk to remember it. 
[122]No shit.  She won't even look at me  
[123]She just needs time to cool off I'll give it a day. 
[124]Maybe two. 
[125]You makin' any headway? 
[126]Where? 
[127]I don't know, Dorsey. ..the limo.-the flowers.  Another hundred for the tux -- 
[128]Excuse me, have you seen The Feminine Mystique?  I lost my copy. 
[129]I heard there was a poetry reading. 
[130]Pleasant? 
[131]Wholesome. 
[132]Unwelcome?  I guess someone still has her panties in a twist. 
[133]So what did I have an effect on ? 
[134]You were right. She's still pissed. 
[135]Man -- don't say shit like that to  me. People can hear you. 
[136]What's the worst? 
[137]If I go down. I'm takin' her with me 
[138]"This morning, I woke up with this feeling, I didn't know how to deal with, and so I just decided to myself--" 
[139]"I'd hide it to myself.  And never talk about it.  And didn't I go and shout it when you walked into the room --" 
[140]" I think I love you I " 
[141]Flog me. 
[142]Look up, sunshine 
[143]I guess I never told you I'm afraid of heights. 
[144]Try lookin' at it from this angle 
[145]Forget it.  I'm stayin'. 
[146]Maybe. 
[147]I figured it had to be something ridiculous to win your respect.  And piss you off. 
[148]So how'd you get Chapin to look the other way? 
[149]A soft side? Who knew? 
[150]So what's your excuse? 
[151]Yes 
[152]So if you disappoint them from the start, you're covered? 
[153]Then you screwed up 
[154]You never disappointed me. 
[155]You up for it? 
[156]Fallacy. 
[157]Hearsay. 
[158]Do you? 
[159]I hate peas. 
[160]You're sweet.  And sexy.  And completely hot for me. 
[161]No one else knows 
[162]Go to the prom with me 
[163]You know what I mean 
[164]No what? 
[165]Why not? 
[166]People won't expect you to go... 
[167]So I have to have a motive to be with you? 
[168]You need therapy.  Has anyone ever told you that? 
[169]Nothing!  There's nothing in it for me. Just the pleasure of your company. 
[170]cover that up 
[171]It's Scurvy's.  His date got convicted. Where'd you get the dress? 
[172]Oh huh 
[173]No prob. 
[174]Look, Clem even wore his good boots 
[175]My grandmother's . 
[176]That's where I was last year.  She'd never lived alone -- my grandfather died -- I stayed with her.  I wasn't in jail, I don't know Marilyn Manson, and I've never slept with a Spice Girl.  I spent a year sitting next to my grandma on the couch watching Wheel of Fortune.  End of story. 
[177]It gets worse -- you still have your freshman yearbook? 
[178]Wait I... 
[179]It wasn't like that. 
[180]I didn't care about the money. 
[181]I cared about -- 
[182]I thought you could use it. When you start your band. 
[183]Besides, I had some extra cash. Some asshole paid me to take out a really great girl. 
[184]Yeah, but then I fucked up. I fell for her. 
[185]You know -- it's not every day you find a girl who'll flash her tits to get you out of detention. 
[186]I know 
[187]Because I like to torture you. 
[188]Don ' t you even dare. . . 
[189]She tries to keep him from grabbing the yearbook that Bianca now hands her.  
[190]Ask my attorney.
dialogues.BIANCA:
[1]Did you change your hair? 
[2]You might wanna think about it 
[3]Not really. 
[4]Nowhere... Hi, Daddy. 
[5]Is there even a question that we want her to stay? 
[6]Now don't get upset. Daddy, but there's this boy... and I think he might ask... 
[7]What if she never starts dating? 
[8]But it's not fair -- she's a mutant, Daddy! 
[9]But she doesn't want to date. 
[10]Can we make this quick?  Roxanne Korrine and Andrew Barrett are having an incredibly horrendous public break- up on the quad.  Again. 
[11]Not the hacking and gagging and spitting part.  Please.  
[12]You're asking me out.  That's so cute. What's your name again? 
[13]No, no, it's my fault -- we didn't have a proper introduction --- 
[14]The thing is, Cameron -- I'm at the mercy of a particularly hideous breed of loser.  My sister.  I can't date until she does. 
[15]The problem is, she's completely anti-social.  
[16]Unsolved mystery.  She used to be really popular when she started high school, then it was just like she got sick of it or something. 
[17]Gosh, if only we could find Kat a boyfriend... 
[18]C'esc ma tete. This is my head 
[19]I don't want to know how to say that though.  I want to know useful things. Like where the good stores are.  How much does champagne cost?  Stuff like Chat.  I have never in my life had to point out my head to someone. 
[20]Forget French. 
[21]How is our little Find the Wench A Date plan progressing? 
[22]Show me 
[23]Give me a sign when he walks by.  And don't point. 
[24]Where? 
[25]My God, he's repulsive. He's so perfect! 
[26]Have you ever considered a new look? I mean, seriously, you could have some potential buried under all this hostility. 
[27]Can you at least start wearing a bra? 
[28]A "copine" is someone you can count on. An "ami" is someone who makes promises he can't keep. 
[29]I counted on you to help my cause. You and that thug are obviously failing. Aren't we ever going on our date? 
[30]You're sweet. 
[31]Eber's Deep Conditioner every two days. And I never, ever use a blowdryer without the diffuser attachment. 
[32]You did? 
[33]I think I like the white shirt 
[34]Expensive? 
[35]Hopefully. 
[36]Have you heard about Bogey Lowenstein's party? 
[37]I really, really, really wanna go, but I can't.  Not unless my sister goes. 
[38]Lesbian?  No. I found a picture of Jared Leto in one of her drawers, so I'm pretty sure she's not harboring same-sex tendencies. 
[39]Who knows?  All I've ever heard her say is that she'd dip before dating a guy that smokes. 
[40]Can you turn down the Screaming Menstrual Bitches?  I'm trying to study. 
[41]Don't tell me you're actually going out?  On a school night, no less. 
[42]Oh my God, does this mean you're becoming normal? 
[43]Oh, I thought you might have a date I don't know why I'm bothering to ask, but are you going to Bogey Lowenstein's party Saturday night? 
[44]I think you're a freak.  I think you do this to torture me.  And I think you suck. 
[45]She's obviously not going. 
[46]Daddy, I -- 
[47]If you must know, we were attempting to go to a small study group of friends. 
[48]It's just a party. Daddy, but I knew you'd forbid me to go since "Gloria Steinem" over there isn't going -- 
[49]Daddy, people expect me to be there! 
[50]You're ruining my life'  Because you won't be normal, I can't be normal. 
[51]Bogey Lowenstein's party is normal, but you're too busy listening to Bitches Who Need Prozac to know that. 
[52]Can't you forget for just one night that you're completely wretched? 
[53]Like I'm supposed to know what that even means. 
[54]Yeah, he's your freak friend Mandella's boyfriend.  I guess since I'm not allowed to go out, I should obsess over a dead guy, too. 
[55]It's just a party. Daddy. 
[56]Daddy, no! 
[57]You are so completely unbalanced. 
[58]Why? 
[59]Bianca keeps walking, ignoring Kat  A GUY pouring shots hands Kat one She downs it and accepts another.  
[60]Where did he go?  He was just here. 
[61]Joey. 
[62]Hi. 
[63]You know Chastity? 
[64]Would you mind getting me a drink, Cameron? 
[65]Surprise me. 
[66]Queen Harry? 
[67]Neat... 
[68]I'll be right back. 
[69]He practically proposed when he found out we had the same dermatologist. I mean. Dr. Bonchowski is great an all, but he's not exactly relevant party conversation. 
[70]Combination.  I don't know -- I thought he'd be different.  More of a gentleman... 
[71]Sometimes I wonder if the guys we're supposed to want to go out with are the ones we actually want to go out with, you know? 
[72]I really don't think I need any social advice from you right now. 
[73]Dinner taste better on the way out? 
[74]I don't get you.  You act like you're too good for any of this, and then you go totally apeshit when you get here. 
[75]I have to be home in twenty minutes. 
[76]Tons 
[77]Cameron? 
[78]Do you think you could give me a ride home? 
[79]
[80]I was? 
[81]Well, no... 
[82]But 
[83]Hi, Joey. 
[84]You know the deal.  I can ' t go if Kat doesn't go -- 
[85]Since when? 
[86]Quick question -- are you going to the prom? 
[87]Then Guillermo says, "If you go any lighter, you're gonna look like an extra on 90210." 
[88]do you listen to this crap?

[47]Hey - I appreciate gratitude as much as the next guy, but it's not gonna do you any good to be known as New Kid Who Embraces Guys In The Bathroom.  Cameron pulls back and attempts to posture himself in a manly way for the others, now watching.
